channel.title: interest on My News Aggregator
channel.description: Recent content in interest on My News Aggregator

item.title: Ireland, Wales and the scholar who helped unravel their Celtic connections
item.description: Cecile O’Rahilly was responsible for groundbreaking research on the historical and literary ties between Ireland and Wales.

item.title: The UK’s suspension of some arms exports to Israel was highly political – here’s how to understand it
item.description: David Lammy is not the first Labour foreign secretary to revisit arms contracts on ethical grounds.

item.title: When did the climate crisis begin?
item.description: A new book argues that climate change rose from imperialism and capitalism.

item.title: Pro-Putin movement expands across the former Soviet bloc – here’s why
item.description: East Germans are not the only former members of the Soviet bloc who are moving closer to Putin’s position on the Ukraine war.

item.title: How stories can teach young people about life in a changing climate
item.description: Drawing on students’ personal experiences can be a helpful way of approaching climate adaptation.

item.title: Grenfell Tower report: an expert explains why so many people have been blamed
item.description: The inquiry accused companies of misleading the market to make cladding products seem safer than they were known to be.

item.title: Grenfell victims were ‘overcome by toxic gases’ – this is the deadly construction loophole that helped cause their deaths
item.description: Manufacturers have to provide information on the fire behaviour of construction products, but there is no requirement to quantify the toxicity of the smoke.

item.title: Licking an ice lolly at school might make a good memory – but this isn’t the secret to learning science
item.description: If you stop to think about it, most of your knowledge can’t be clearly tied to one particular experience.

item.title: As hair transplants become big business, here’s what you need to know about the risks
item.description: Hair today, gone tomorrow? Not with the latest transplant procedures – but what are the risks?

item.title: Oasis tickets: how dynamic pricing works – and how touts may have driven up prices
item.description: It’s a question of supply and demand – but does that make it fair?
